docs.snippet: People are using social media in the fight against the Dakota Access pipeline project, but the authorities say they’re not fooling anyone.

headline.main: Why Your Facebook Friends Are Checking In to Standing Rock

docs.snippet: Facebook promises to increase use of outside measurement services for ads and to expand use of metrics services, among other measures.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Acts to Restore Trust After Overstating Video Views
headline.main: Facebook Acts to Restore Trust After Overstating Video Views

docs.snippet: Israel has pushed to combat online provocation that it links to bloodshed, while Palestinians consider a crackdown on posts just another tool of repression.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Struggles to Put Out Online Fires in Israeli-Palestinian Conflict
headline.main: Facebook Struggles to Put Out Online Fires in Israeli-Palestinian Conflict

docs.abstract: Global debate regarding Facebook, free speech and issue of incitement may be most keenly relevant to conditions in Israel, West Bank and Gaza, where terrorism is daily reality and role Facebook and other social media play in inciting it is deeply controversial; issue has taken on urgency after 14 months of repeated stabbings and vehicular assaults by Palestinians against Israelis.

docs.snippet: Facebook, Google, Twitter and Microsoft announced they have teamed up to fight the spread of such content online by sharing technology and information.

headline.print_headline: Facebook and Other Tech Companies Seek to Curb the Flow of Terrorist Content
headline.main: Facebook and Other Tech Companies Seek to Curb Flow of Terrorist Content

docs.abstract: Facebook, Google, Twitter and Microsoft announce they will partner to prevent spread of terrorist content online; plan involves digitally tagging terrorist images and videos and then compiling tags into shared database that makes it easier to spot and remove such content across their respective platforms.

docs.snippet: The social network remained strong, topping 1.79 billion monthly visitors and nearly tripling its profit, to $2.38 billion, in the third quarter.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Defies Social Media Gravity With Earnings and User Growth
headline.main: Facebook Defies Social Media Gravity With User and Profit Growth

docs.snippet: The social media giant is embroiled in accusations that it spread misinformation and fake news stories that influenced how the American electorate voted.

headline.print_headline: Facebook, in Cross Hairs After Election, Is Said to Question Its Influence
headline.main: Facebook, in Cross Hairs After Election, Is Said to Question Its Influence

docs.abstract: Facebook executives appear to be questioning whether social media platform influenced outcome of presidential election; company has been accused of helping to spread racist ideology and false news stories, which benefited Donald J Trump's presidential campaign.

docs.snippet: A prominent journalist has been accused of libel for sharing a Facebook post that alleged corrupt dealings among the elite in the Asian country.

headline.print_headline: Defamation Suit Over a Shared Facebook Post Is a Test of Press Freedom in Bhutan
headline.main: Bhutan Faces an Important Test of Press Freedom

docs.abstract: Prominent journalist Namgay Zam of Bhutan is jailed and faces defamation suit for sharing Facebook post documenting property dispute involving local businessman; Bhutan's Prime Min Tshering Tobgay calls case one of landmark significance, with potential to shape restrictions on social media usage in country.

docs.snippet: The tool was created with data collected from election officials by the nonpartisan research group Center for Technology and Civic Life.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Tool Makes Sample Ballots Available to All
headline.main: Facebook Can Tell You What to Expect in the Voting Booth

docs.snippet: The reason you saw a particular campaign ad on Facebook may have nothing to do with your political views, or even your demographic profile.

headline.main: Why Facebook Showed You That Ad for the Candidate You Hate

docs.snippet: After criticism that they might have allowed fake news to influence the 2016 election, the companies are banning such sites from using their advertising services.

headline.print_headline: Google and Facebook Use Ad Policies to Take Aim at Fake News Sites
headline.main: Google and Facebook Take Aim at Fake News Sites

docs.abstract: Google and Facebook are enacting new policies to curb spread of fake news sites on their networks; both companies are being heavily criticized for influencing outcome of presidential election by not removing false and misleading content from their platforms and searches.
